gameComponents

Class Mirror

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameComponents.GameComponent
      • gameComponents.OpticalObject
        • gameComponents.Mirror
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CurvedMirror

    public class Mirror
extends OpticalObject
    Virtual Optics

    This class models a plane mirror

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • angle

        private double angle
        The angle from the horizontal to the bounding point (b[0], b[1])

      • length

        private double length
        Length of the plane mirror

      • orientation

        private int orientation
        The orientation can take the values: NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST, Q1, Q2, Q3 or Q4. It is the direction that the reflective side of the mirror is facing

      • checkOrientation

        public boolean checkOrientation(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p,
                       java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersection,
                       LineEq segment)
        The arguments intersection and segment, are not used here but they are in the subclass
        Specified by:
        checkOrientation in class OpticalObject
        Parameters:
        p - The source point of the ray segment that hit this optical object
        intersection - The intersection point of the ray segment and this optical object
        segment - The ray segment that hit this optical object
        Returns:
        True if the ray can interact with this side of the optical object, false otherwise
